Articles.Content:
YES! After many attempts, two hours and a very confusing HJKIL control scheme, I rendezvoused two ships and docked them! This is probably the hardest thing I've ever done in KSP. But now that I know how, everything becomes easier! Space stations, Apollo-style missions, huge ships for grand and not-so-grand tours... this is a new era for my space program!

I'll probably build a space station next, or maybe I've had enough of docking for a while... but I don't want to forget how to do it. In any case, now I need a nice hot shower...
Docking Is Certain The Hardest Thing I've Tried Without MJ Help. Congrats!
Nice work!

congrats for sure

it is always a great feeling when they connect into one after a long time of adjusting

it will get easier and easier every time you dock

p.s. keep those RCA centered and balanced.. pain in the butt when the ship isn't balanced

Congratulations Jedi

Patience, you have learned

Congrats!

It does get easier each time you do it. If you go a while between docking, you do lose a tiny bit of skill, but quickly regain it after a few near misses

Well done!

Next, a 400 ton space station
You can come visit me on Duna anytime.

Good. Now keep doing and doing and doing it until docking seems like nothing to you.

And use the force. You didn't became a Jedi Master for nothing.

Congratulations! Compared to rendezvous, the docking part is easy. I highly recommend Blizzy's docking tutorial thread and video, and install the docking trainer scenario he made for in-game practice.

Thanks for all the praise guys! And, yes, the Star Wars jokes have been noticed and appreciated.

Well done!

Next, a 400 ton space station

400? The ISS is 450!

YES! After many attempts, two hours and a very confusing HJKIL control scheme, I rendezvoused two ships and docked them! This is probably the hardest thing I've ever done in KSP. But now that I know how, everything becomes easier!

HNJKLI is easier when you enter Chase View. It's one of the secrets of successful docking. Oh yeah, and congrats. It's definitely a milestone in your KSP lifetime for sure.

HNJKLI is easier when you enter Chase View. It's one of the secrets of successful docking. Oh yeah, and congrats. It's definitely a milestone in your KSP lifetime for sure.

Maybe it's because I was facing the sun, but I actually found Chase View to be harder. Plus, I still have six buttons to keep track of. And, thanks.
I never use hnjkli, I always just hit space to swap between rotate, and strafe mode. I find it much easier, for me anyways.

Well done and congrats

Now.. get your twin rover+ single lander ship to Laythe, dock with the orbiting fuel tanker, before landing rovers + lander on the surface and returning the crew to Kerbin

11 dockings in total, in both LKO and Laythe orbit.

Boris

Or maybe just a space station with a couple of solar panels first

YES! After many attempts, two hours and a very confusing HJKIL control scheme, I rendezvoused two ships and docked them!

It took me also a lot of time...but when you managed it you have defiately made a "giant leap" and working that out gives you a lot of knowledge and experience that brings you realy further in this game.

grats!

Thanks for all the praise guys! And, yes, the Star Wars jokes have been noticed and appreciated.

400? The ISS is 450!

In that case...

500 tons!

Docking is easy for me, it's the rendezvousing that I can't figure out.

Grats to the OP!
I'm with the op. Rendesvous wasn't that hard for me (remember that it's basically a lunar intercept in small scale). But docking took me over an hour the first (and only) time!
Yeah,you finally docked next you can make a space station or interplanetary transfer Vehicle in orbit.
This is the beginning of my first space station, which I am calling Hatfield Station, after Chris Hatfield. I hope I spelled his last name right.

This is the beginning of my first space station, which I am calling Hatfield Station, after Chris Hatfield. I hope I spelled his last name right.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Hadfield

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Hadfield

Ah, darn it. Maybe I can get away with saying that there was a clerical error.

...Or I could just rename it.

James Hetfield?

Congrats on docking! For me, it's the most fun thing in KSP. Once you get the hang of it, it's easy. Try Lazor Docking Cams if you're into mods.

I think Im addicted to docking!

its so satisfying when those 2 (or more) docking ports lock together.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/bspngwo73ahzs36/station%2090.jpg

(not enough posts to post pics yet...thought I had...)

once you get into multipul port docking the satisfaction meter goes off!

Do use the Lazor docking port camera and the docking port alignment mod.

I have a triple screen setup and never dock without these mods on.

2 of the most used mods I have.

Its a dam good feeling isn't it!? lol
